name: AI-Driven Unemployment Crisis with UBI Policy Response
description: Simulation of economic effects from rapidly rising AI-driven unemployment over 30 years, including UBI implementation at 12% unemployment threshold

assumptions: AI displacement increases unemployment by 1% per year up to 30% total
AI boosts productivity from 2% to 6% as displacement increases
UBI provides $15,000 per person annually with 50-100% coverage
GDP sensitivity to employment changes has 0.6 elasticity
Government spending capped at 30% of GDP
Progressive tax adjustment strategy scales with unemployment
outputs: GDP over 30 years with productivity vs employment trade-offs
UBI trigger points and associated costs
Government budget balance and fiscal sustainability
Comparison between UBI and no-UBI scenarios
Tax rate adjustments needed for fiscal balance
